wikipedia_page.main: William Henry Battle (23 February 1855 – 1936) was an English surgeon and teacher.

response: |Battle's sign   ||  William Henry Battle  || neurosurgery/traumatology  || basal skull fracture || ||mastoid ecchymosis

Battle's sign, also known as mastoid ecchymosis, is an indication of fracture of middle cranial fossa of the skull. These fractures may be associated with underlying brain trauma. Battle's sign consists of bruising over the mastoid process as a result of extravasation of blood along the path of the posterior auricular artery. The sign is named after William Henry Battle.
*William Henry Battle, surgeon, known for Battle's sign: c. 1866–70

The son of William Henry Battle and Anna Marguerite (née Vulliamy). Battle was educated at Gresham's School, Norfolk, and Trinity College, Cambridge. His father's family (Battle) were farmers in Lincolnshire.
*****Anna Marguerite Vulliamy (1867–1946), married the plastic surgeon, William Henry Battle (1855–1936) and had five children.

link_mentions.page: List of people educated at Haileybury and Imperial Service College

response: *William Henry Battle (1855-1936). Attended Lincoln Grammar School and then Haileybury School, Hertfordshire. From 1889 to 1890 he held the title of Hunterian Professor of Surgery and Pathology at the Royal College of Surgeons of England.
